result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Maclin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges including DNA, and supervision fees as determined by DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.
Attend and successfully complete anger management and cognitive thinking programming.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, Huber if revoked.
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and  cogitive thinking programming.
-Maintain employment.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges(including DNA), and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample. 
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights forms

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however Branch 31 is in jury trial, case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
For reasons stated on the record,  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defendant is not present but defense counsel reports that he is on his way.  Case passed.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel is without her file.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 04.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the status conference.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4 is in trial.  Attorney Carlson is in trial in this court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The jury trial on the defendant's pending felony was adjourned.  Court grants defense request for an adjournment of the plea hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a pending felony before Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  This court has no objection to this case being resolved as part of a global resolution with the pending felony.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin not in court, defendant in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was taken into custody on a felony warrant today.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on December 16, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense is not yet in receipt of all discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Anthony L Maclin not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense waives the appearanc of the defendant for this hearing only.  Defense needs to obtain additional discovery from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Anthony L Maclin not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Anthony L Maclin in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Anthony L Maclin in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
